It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers. The plant has linear, rigid leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is typically found in coastal or inland areas. Stylidium rigidifolium is a short-lived perennial, often growing to a height of only a few centimeters.
